availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
To His Excellency B. Magoffin
Governor of the commonwealth of Kentucky &c &c
Honble Sir

Being informed that Geo, Morris, Esqr. a Justice of the peace, for Jefferson County in the district composed of the 3rd and 4th Wards in the City of Louisville has resigned his Office, as Justice of the peace, I the undersigned petitioner would respectfully represent to your Excellency that I am desirous of filling the vacancy occasioned by said resignation if it be consonant to your Excellency's wish

I have the Honor to be
your Excellency's most
Respectfully
Thos. Mitchell
I have known Mr Mitchell for some years & know him to be well qualified

J H Harney
James Speed
Henry Dent
